attributes.action: end the practice of 'double taxation' on fuel by applying VAT on petrol/diesel BEFORE fuel duty is added and not AFTER
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With motorists paying some £28 billion a year of taxation into the Treasury, the scandalous  practice of charging VAT on petrol/diesel  AFTER fuel duty is added is simply a tax on tax.

For example, based on 1 litre of petrol/diesel at £1:
Basic cost – 35p,
Fuel Duty – 52p,
VAT (15%) – 13p,
Total = £1.00

Appling VAT on petrol/diesel AFTER adding Fuel Duty rather than before generates an additional 8p per litre for the Treasury – a tax on tax. This is an unfair practice which should cease immediately.
